revision.text:
{{pp-vandalism|small=yes}} {{Use British English|date=June 2017}} {{Use dmy dates|date=January 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Kieran Trippier | image = Kieran Trippier 2018-07-14 1.jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Trippier playing for [[England national football team|England]] at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] | fullname = Kieran John Trippier<ref>{{cite web |url=https://tournament.fifadata.com/documents/FWC/2018/pdf/FWC_2018_SQUADLISTS.PDF |title=FIFA World Cup Russia 2018: List of players: England |publisher=FIFA |format=PDF |page=10 |date=15 July 2018 |accessdate=6 October 2018}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1990|9|19|df=y}}<ref>{{Hugman|25603|accessdate=3 September 2018}}</ref> | birth_place = [[Bury, Greater Manchester|Bury]], England | height = {{convert|1.78|m|order=flip}}<ref>{{cite web |url=https://uk.soccerway.com/players/kieran-trippier/97354/ |title=K. Trippier: Summary |website=Soccerway |publisher=Perform Group |accessdate=25 November 2018}}</ref> | position = [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|Right back]] / [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|Right wing-back]] | currentclub = [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] | clubnumber = 2 | youthyears1 = 1999–2009 | youthclubs1 = [[Manchester City F.C. Reserves and Academy|Manchester City]] | years1 = 2009–2012 | clubs1 = [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] | caps1 = 0 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2010 | clubs2 = → [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]] (loan) | caps2 = 3 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2010–2011 | clubs3 = → [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]] (loan) | caps3 = 39 | goals3 = 2 | years4 = 2011–2012 | clubs4 = → [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] (loan) | caps4 = 25 | goals4 = 1 | years5 = 2012–2015 | clubs5 = [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] | caps5 = 145 | goals5 = 4 | years6 = 2015– | clubs6 = [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] | caps6 = 64 | goals6 = 2 | nationalyears1 = 2007 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-18 football team|England U18]] | nationalcaps1 = 1 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2008–2009 | nationalteam2 = [[England national under-19 football team|England U19]] | nationalcaps2 = 10 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2009 | nationalteam3 = [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]] | nationalcaps3 = 3 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalyears4 = 2010–2011 | nationalteam4 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] | nationalcaps4 = 2 | nationalgoals4 = 0 | nationalyears5 = 2017– | nationalteam5 = [[England national football team|England]] | nationalcaps5 = 16 | nationalgoals5 = 1 | club-update = 02:11, 28 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 08:13, 16 December 2018 (UTC) }} '''Kieran John Trippier''' (born 19 September 1990) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|right back]] for {{English football updater|TottenhH}} club [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] and the [[England national football team|English national team]].
Trippier started his career in the youth system at [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] but failed to make the breakthrough to the first team, having two loans at [[EFL Championship|Championship]] club [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]]. In 2011, he signed for Championship club [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] on a season-long loan which was made permanent in January 2012 for an undisclosed fee. He was named in the Championship [[PFA Team of the Year]] for two consecutive seasons in 2012–13 and 2013–14. In 2014, he secured promotion with Burnley to the Premier League as the team finished runners-up in the Championship. A year later, he signed for Tottenham for a £3.5 million fee.
Trippier also represented England at all levels from under-18 to under-21, featuring in the [[2009 UEFA European Under-19 Championship]] and [[2009 FIFA U-20 World Cup]]. He made his senior international debut in June 2017 and was part of the team that reached the semi-finals of the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].
==Early life== Trippier was born in [[Bury, Greater Manchester|Bury]], Greater Manchester,<ref>{{cite book |editor-first=Barry J. |editor-last=Hugman |title=The PFA Footballers' Who's Who 2010–11 |year=2010 |publisher=Mainstream Publishing |location=Edinburgh |isbn=978-1-84596-601-0 |page=413}}</ref> to Chris Trippier and Eleanor Lomax.<ref name="New dad Trippier"/> He has three brothers, Chris, Curtis and [[Kelvin Lomax|Kelvin]].<ref name="New dad Trippier"/> He grew up in [[Summerseat]] in [[Ramsbottom]], Greater Manchester and attended Holcombe Brook Primary School until 2002,<ref name="lancashiretelegraph">{{cite news |url=http://www.lancashiretelegraph.co.uk/news/rossendale/16290922.Ramsbottom_teachers__pride_in_Kieran_Trippier/ |title=Ramsbottom teachers' pride in Kieran Trippier |date=15 June 2018 |work=Lancashire Telegraph }}</ref> followed by [[Woodhey High School]] where he studied for five years and finished in 2007.<ref>{{cite news |url= http://www.burytimes.co.uk/sport/15321506.Woodhey_old_boy_Trippier__39_s_England_call_up_an_inspiration_for_whole_school__says_former_teacher/ |title= Kieran Trippier's England call-up an inspiration for whole school, says Woodhey teacher |first=Craig|last= Nelson |date=31 May 2017 |newspaper=Bury Times }}</ref> He played in the school football team and helped them win the Bury Cup twice and Greater Manchester Trophy once.<ref name="lancashiretelegraph"/> His family are [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] fans, and although he was scouted by United when he was eight, he chose to join Manchester City's academy as he knew a few friends there and it was local for him.<ref name="New dad Trippier"/><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/nov/07/kieran-trippier-england-world-cup-tottenham-burnley-big-flag |title=No flagging from Kieran Trippier after finally achieving his England dream |first=Dominic |last=Fifield|date=7 November 2017 |newspaper=The Guardian }}</ref>
==Club career== ===Manchester City=== Trippier joined [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]]'s academy at the age of nine, where he progressed through the ranks at the club, signing his first professional contract in 2007.<ref>{{cite news |title=Football academies: kicking and screaming |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/4938593/Football-academies-kicking-and-screaming.html# |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London | date=4 March 2009}}</ref> In the [[2007–08 Manchester City F.C. season|2007–08 season]] he became a regular in the reserve team<ref name="England Profile">{{cite web |title=Kieran Trippier |url=http://www.thefa.com/England/All-Teams/Players/T/Kieran-Trippier |publisher=The Football Association |accessdate=10 June 2017}}</ref> and was part of the team that won the [[FA Youth Cup]].<ref name=FAYC>{{cite news |first=Mark |last=Ogden |title=FA Youth Cup: Manchester City crush Chelsea |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/2297541/FA-Youth-Cup-Manchester-City-crush-Chelsea.html |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=17 April 2008 |accessdate=15 December 2017}}</ref> In August 2009, he featured in the prestige friendly against [[FC Barcelona]] at the [[Camp Nou]].<ref name="Trippier on loan at Barnsley">{{cite web |title=Trippier on loan at Barnsley |url=http://www.mcfc.co.uk/News/Team-news/Archive/2010/February/Trippier-on-loan-at-Barnsley |publisher=Manchester City F.C. | date=9 February 2010}}</ref> He joined the first-team for the pre-season tour of the United States in the summer of 2010.<ref name="Trippier retraces steps across Pennines"/>
===Barnsley=== In February 2010, he joined [[EFL Championship|Championship]] club [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]] on a one-month loan.<ref name="Trippier on loan at Barnsley"/><ref>{{cite news |title= Barnsley sign Manchester City defender Kieran Trippier |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/b/barnsley/8506954.stm |publisher=BBC Sport | date=9 February 2010}}</ref> He went on to make three appearances during the loan spell, making his debut in a 2–1 defeat at [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]].<ref name="Trippier on loan at Barnsley"/> His loan was cut short after he suffered an injury at [[Scunthorpe United F.C.|Scunthorpe United]] which kept him out for ten days.<ref>{{cite web |title=Trippier happy with loan spell |url=http://www.mcfc.co.uk/News/Team-news/Archive/2010/March/Trippier-happy-with-loan-spell |publisher=Manchester City F.C. | date=7 March 2010}}</ref> In August 2010, he re-joined Barnsley for his second spell with the club on a six-month loan deal.<ref name="Trippier retraces steps across Pennines">{{cite web |title=Trippier retraces steps across Pennines |url=http://www.mcfc.co.uk/News/Team-news/Archive/2010/August/Trippier-retraces-steps-across-Pennines |publisher=Manchester City F.C. | date=7 August 2010}}</ref> He made his second debut for the club in the 1–0 home defeat to [[Rochdale A.F.C.|Rochdale]] in the [[EFL Cup|League Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Barnsley 0–1 Rochdale|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/league_cup/8893788.stm|publisher=BBC Sport | date=10 August 2010}}</ref> In January 2011, Trippier agreed a deal to stay at Barnsley for the remainder of the 2010–11 season.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.barnsleyfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10309~2259846,00.html |title=Trippier staying at Oakwell |publisher=Barnsley F.C. |date=7 January 2011 |accessdate=20 January 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110110190924/http://www.barnsleyfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10309~2259846%2C00.html |archivedate=10 January 2011 }}</ref> He scored his first senior goal for [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]] in a 3–3 draw with [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]], with a curling free-kick from twenty-five yards out at [[Elland Road]] in February 2011.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_1/9402089.stm "Leeds 3–3 Barnsley"]. BBC Sport. 22 February 2010. Retrieved 10 January 2012.</ref> His second goal came against local rivals [[Doncaster Rovers F.C.|Doncaster Rovers]] with another spectacular free-kick, equalising late on for the hosts at [[Oakwell]].<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/13112129.stm "Barnsley 2–2 Doncaster"]. BBC Sport. 25 April 2011. Retrieved 10 January 2012.</ref> He went on to make forty-one appearances in all competitions,<ref name=sb1011/> winning the Young Player of the Year award.<ref name=YPOTY>{{cite news |first=Chris |last=Boden |title=Former Tyke Trippier looking forward to Oakwell return |url=https://www.clitheroeadvertiser.co.uk/sport/football/former-tyke-trippier-looking-forward-to-oakwell-return-1-3880049 |newspaper=Clitheroe Advertiser and Times |date=18 October 2011 |accessdate=15 December 2017}}</ref>
===Burnley=== [[File:Kieran Trippier.jpg|thumb|upright|Trippier playing for [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] in 2011]]
In July 2011, Trippier joined Championship club [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]] on a season-long loan as a replacement for the departing [[Tyrone Mears]].<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14296621.stm "Burnley sign Kieran Trippier on loan"]. BBC Sport. 26 July 2011. Retrieved 10 January 2012.</ref> He made his debut for the Clarets in August 2011, a 2–2 home draw with [[Watford F.C.|Watford]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Kieran Trippier profile – Claretsmad |url=http://www.clarets-mad.co.uk/feat/ed35/kieran_trippier_689028/index.shtml |website=Claretsmad | accessdate=16 July 2014}}</ref> His first goal for the club came in September 2011, with a superb long-range free-kick against [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|Milton Keynes Dons]] in a 2–1 win in the League Cup.<ref>{{cite news |title=Burnley 2–1 Milton Keynes Dons |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/league_cup/14893508.stm |publisher=BBC Sport | date= 17 December 2011| accessdate=16 July 2014}}</ref> His first league goal came in December 2011, a 1–0 win over [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] at the [[Falmer Stadium]], with a powerful shot from the edge of the box.<ref>{{cite news |title=Brighton & Hove Albion 1–0 Burnley |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/16123505 |publisher=BBC Sport | date= 17 December 2011| accessdate=16 July 2014}}</ref> In December 2011, after impressing during his loan, Trippier was nominated for the Championship Player of the Month award.<ref>[http://www.burnleyfootballclub.com/page/ProfilesDetail/0,,10413~50729,00.html "Kieran Trippier Team Profile"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120106014624/http://www.burnleyfootballclub.com/page/ProfilesDetail/0%2C%2C10413~50729%2C00.html |date= 6 January 2012 }} Burnley FC. Retrieved 10 January 2012.</ref> On 2 January 2012, he received his first professional red card for picking up two bookings in a 2–1 defeat to [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]].<ref name="Big news as Trippier signs new deal">{{cite news |title=Big news as Trippier signs new deal |url=http://www.clarets-mad.co.uk/news/tmnw/big_news_as_trippier_signs_new_deal_833914/index.shtml|website=Claretsmad |date = 31 May 2014| accessdate=16 July 2014}}</ref> A day later, Burnley signed Trippier on a permanent deal for an undisclosed fee, signing a three-and-a-half-year contract.<ref>{{ cite news | url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/16394381.stm | title=Burnley sign Kieran Trippier on permanent deal | publisher=BBC | work=BBC Sport | date=3 January 2012 | accessdate=10 January 2012}}</ref> In January 2012 he scored his second goal for the club, scoring from range in a 2–0 win away to [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]].<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_1/16453448.stm "Middlesbrough 0–2 Burnley"]. BBC Sport. 14 January 2012. Retrieved 15 January 2012.</ref> In March 2012, he scored the first in a 5–1 rout against [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]] at [[Fratton Park]].<ref>[https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/17496929 "Portsmouth 1–5 Burnley"]. BBC Sport. 31 March 2012. Retrieved 3 April 2012.</ref> He played in all 46 league games in his first season as the club finished in mid-table, going on to win the Burnley Player of the Year award.<ref name=POTY>{{cite news |title=Kieran Trippier named Burnley's player of the year |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/17897816 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 April 2012 |accessdate=15 December 2017}}</ref>
Trippier again went on to impress in his second season with the club being a virtual ever-present as he was named in the Championship [[PFA Team of the Year]] for 2012–13.<ref name=PFA1213>{{cite news |title=Gareth Bale wins PFA Player of Year and Young Player awards |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/22331030 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 April 2013 |accessdate=15 December 2017}}</ref> In August 2013, he scored a free-kick in a 2–0 win over [[Preston North End F.C.|Preston North End]] in the League Cup.<ref>{{cite news|title=Burnley 2–0 Preston North End|url=http://m.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/23764115/0.app|publisher=BBC Sport|date=27 August 2013|accessdate=16 July 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140726090420/http://m.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/23764115/0.app|archivedate=26 July 2014}}</ref> In January 2014, he sealed a 3–2 win over [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield Town]] with a late goal.<ref>{{cite news|title=Burnley 3–2 Huddersfield Town|url=http://m.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/25512912/0.app|publisher=BBC Sport|date=1 January 2014|accessdate=16 July 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140726112412/http://m.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/25512912/0.app|archivedate=26 July 2014}}</ref> He was again named in the Championship PFA Team of the Year for consecutive seasons<ref name=PFA1314>{{cite news |title=Luis Suarez: Liverpool striker wins PFA Player of the Year award |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/27180793 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 April 2014 |accessdate=15 December 2017}}</ref> as Burnley finished runners-up and gained promotion to the [[Premier League]].<ref name=1314table>{{cite web |title=Championship: 2013/14: Latest table |url=http://www.soccerbase.com/tournaments/tournament.sd?tourn_id=1305 |website=Soccerbase |publisher=Centurycomm |accessdate=15 December 2017}}</ref> In May 2014, he signed a new improved three-year contract until 2017 after reported interest from [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]].<ref name="Big news as Trippier signs new deal"/>
===Tottenham Hotspur=== ====2015–16 season==== On 19 June 2015, Trippier signed for Premier League club [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham]] for a reported £3.5 million, after successfully passing a medical, becoming the club's second signing of the summer.<ref>{{ cite news | url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/33174318 | title= Kieran Trippier: Tottenham complete deal for Burnley full-back | date=19 June 2015 | work=BBC Sport | publisher=BBC }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Trippier Completes Spurs Switch |url=http://www.burnleyfootballclub.com/news/article/trippier-completes-spurs-switch-2499748.aspx |publisher=Burnley F.C. |date=19 June 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Tottenham sign Burnley full back Kieran Trippier for £3.5m on five-year contract |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3131701/Tottenham-sign-Burnley-Kieran-Trippier-3-5m-five-year-contract.html |newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London |date=20 June 2015}}</ref> Trippier was expected to compete with [[Kyle Walker]] at right back under manager [[Mauricio Pochettino]], Trippier did not make a start for Tottenham before Christmas as he was eased into the team.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/kieran-trippier-learns-from-rival-kyle-walker-under-spurs-job-share-plan-a6926831.html |title=Tottenham: Kieran Trippier learns from 'rival' Kyle Walker under Spurs' job-share plan |newspaper=The Independent |location=London |first=Jack |last=Pitt-Brooke |date=11 March 2016}}</ref> On 6 February 2016, he scored his first goal for Tottenham, netting a cross from [[Dele Alli]], which turned out to be the winning goal in a 1–0 win over [[Watford F.C.|Watford]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Tottenham 1 Watford 0: Kieran Trippier nets first goal for Spurs as hosts climb to second in Premier League table |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/premier-league/12143967/Tottenham-1-Watford-0-Kieran-Trippier-nets-first-goal-for-Spurs-as-hosts-climb-to-second-in-Premier-League-table.html |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=6 February 2016}}</ref> Trippier appeared in six games for Tottenham during the Premier League season, making five starts as Walker displayed his best form in recent years.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/first-team/kieran-trippier-on-kyle-walker-270516/ |title= We drove each other on, and Kyle's been brilliant – Kieran |publisher=Tottenham Hotspur F.C. |date=27 May 2016}}</ref> However, Trippier played in every minute of Tottenham's [[UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] campaign that reached the last 16.
====2016–17 season==== Despite rumours of a move to [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]],<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailystar.co.uk/sport/football/532479/Southampton-Tottenham-Kieran-Trippier-Premier-league-transfers-rumours-gossip |title= Southampton planning £5m bid for Tottenham defender |newspaper=Daily Star |location=London |first=Alex |last=Crook |date=25 July 2016}}</ref> Trippier confirmed he was "really happy at the club" and that he was "not thinking of leaving".<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/story/2918814/kieran-trippier-happy-at-tottenham-amid-southampton-link |title=Kieran Trippier happy at Tottenham amid Southampton link |first=Dan |last=Kilpatrick |publisher=ESPN |date=27 July 2016 |accessdate=15 December 2017}}</ref> Trippier made his [[UEFA Champions League|Champions League]] debut in a Group stage match at [[CSKA Moscow]] on 27 September 2016.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/715050/Teams-Tottenham-Mauricio-Pochettino-CSKA-Moscow-Champions-League-news |title=Teams: Pochettino makes three changes for Tottenham's Champions League tie with CSKA |newspaper=Daily Express |location=London |first=Charlie |last=Phillippe |date=27 September 2016}}</ref> He performed well in the right back position as replacement for [[Kyle Walker]] who was injured during the [[2016–17 Tottenham Hotspur F.C. season|2016–17 season]], and earned his first call-up for the England national squad.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.standard.co.uk/sport/football/kieran-trippier-scared-by-mauricio-pochettino-tottenham-england-prank-a3558561.html |title=Tottenham's Kieran Trippier 'scared' by Mauricio Pochettino's England prank |first=Tom |last=Doyle |date= 6 June 2017 |newspaper=London Evening Standard }}</ref>
[[File:Chelsea 1 Spurs 3 (40490641594).jpg|thumb|upright|Trippier (left) playing for [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] in 2018]] ====2017–18 season==== On 30 June 2017, Trippier agreed a new five-year contract, committing to the club until 2022.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40449493 |title=Kieran Trippier agrees five-year deal at Tottenham to commit until 2022 |date=30 June 2017 |publisher=BBC Sport }}</ref> As Walker had moved to Manchester City in the summer, Trippier became a regular in the starting line-up of the Spurs team early in the [[2017–18 Tottenham Hotspur F.C. season|2017–18 season]], although he missed the opening game of the season due to an injury sustained in a pre-season friendly against [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] that Spurs won 2–1.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/08/07/kieran-trippier-miss-start-tottenhams-season-ankle-injury/ |title=Kieran Trippier to miss start of Tottenham's season with ankle injury | first=Matt |last=Law|date=7 August 2017 |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph }}</ref> However, a new signing for Tottenham this season [[Serge Aurier]] in September meant that he and Aurier regularly rotated in the right back position.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.hitc.com/en-gb/2017/12/20/time-for-pochettino-to-stick-with-aurier-or-trippier-as-spurs-rb/ |title=Time for Pochettino to stick with Aurier or Trippier as Spurs RB? |first=Tom |last=Seymour|website=HITC |date=20 December 2017}}</ref> He impressed with his performances in the season, in particular during the [[2017–18 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League]] home match against [[Real Madrid C.F.|Real Madrid]] on 1 November 2017, which Spurs won 3–1.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/club/tottenham-hotspur/367/blog/post/3255249/kieran-trippier-delivers-sublime-performance-as-spurs-stun-real-madrid |title=Kieran Trippier delivers sublime performance as Spurs stun Real |first=John |last=Crace |publisher=ESPN |date=2 November 2017 |accessdate=15 December 2017}}</ref>
====2018–19 season==== Trippier made his first start in the [[2018–19 Tottenham Hotspur F.C. season|2018–19 season]] in the game against [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]], and scored his first goal of the season from a free kick.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2018/08/18/tottenham-vs-fulham-live-score-goal-updates-premier-league-3pm/ |title= Kieran Trippier bends it like Beckham and Harry Kane breaks August scoring curse as Tottenham swat aside Fulham |first= Sam |last=Dean|date= 18 August 2018 |work=The Telegraph|accessdate=26 August 2018}}</ref>
==International career== ===Youth=== Trippier was first called up by England at [[England national under-18 football team|under-18]] level in November 2007 for an international friendly against Ghana at the [[Priestfield Stadium]], [[Gillingham F.C.|Gillingham]].<ref>{{cite web | title = Eastick names U18 squad | url = http://www.thefa.com/England/Mens-u18s/news/2009/englandghanasquadnames | publisher = The Football Association | date = 1 November 2007 | accessdate = 16 July 2014}}</ref> He made his debut in the 2–0 victory, coming on as a late substitute for [[Seth Nana Twumasi]].<ref name="England Profile"/><ref>{{cite web | title = Eastick's challenge | url = http://www.thefa.com/England/Mens-u18s/news/2009/englandghanareaction | publisher = The Football Association | date = 21 November 2007 | accessdate = 16 July 2014}}</ref>
He then progressed to the [[England national under-19 football team|under-19]] squad in November 2008 for the [[2009 UEFA European Under-19 Championship qualification]] match against [[Albania national under-19 football team|Albania]], making his debut in the 3–0 win in [[Coleraine]], Northern Ireland.<ref>{{cite web | title = U19s prepare for Albania | url = http://www.thefa.com/england/mens-u19s/News/2009/U19_Albania_preview | publisher = The Football Association | date = 8 October 2008 | accessdate = 16 July 2014}}</ref> He was a mainstay in the team as the squad qualified for the [[2009 UEFA European Under-19 Championship]] finals in Ukraine, and was named in the squad for the finals of the tournament.<ref name="England Profile"/><ref>{{cite web | title = A Trip to Ukraine | url = http://www.thefa.com/england/mens-u19s/News/2009/trippier_vid_180709 | publisher = The Football Association | date = 18 July 2009 | accessdate = 16 July 2014}}</ref> He featured heavily in the tournament as England reached the final but were beaten 2–0 by the hosts [[Ukraine national under-19 football team|Ukraine]].<ref name="England Profile"/>
After reaching the final, England qualified for the [[2009 FIFA U-20 World Cup]] in Egypt a month later and Trippier was named in the twenty-one man squad.<ref name="England Profile"/><ref>{{Cite web | title = U20 World Cup squad named | url = http://www.thefa.com/England/Mens-u20s/news/2009/wc_squad_announcement?c=1 | publisher = The Football Association | date = 11 September 2009 | accessdate = 16 July 2014}}</ref> He featured in all three games as England were eliminated finishing bottom of the group with defeats to [[Uruguay national under-20 football team|Uruguay]] and [[Ghana national under-20 football team|Ghana]], and the 1–1 draw with [[Uzbekistan national under-20 football team|Uzbekistan]].<ref name="England Profile"/> In October 2010, he received his first call-up to the [[England national under-21 football team|under-21 squad]] for the [[2011 UEFA European Under-21 Championship]] play-off against [[Romania national under-21 football team|Romania]], however he failed to feature.<ref>{{Cite news | title = Man City fullback Trippier wins first England U21 call | url = http://www.tribalfootball.com/articles/man-city-fullback-trippier-wins-first-england-u21-call-1162241 | publisher = Tribal Football | accessdate = 16 July 2014}}</ref> He made his debut a month later in the international friendly with [[Germany national under-21 football team|Germany]], a 2–0 defeat.<ref>{{Cite news | title = Psycho calls up City kid Trippier | url = https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/manchester-city-defender-kieran-trippier-3348367 |newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London | date = 5 October 2010 | accessdate = 16 July 2014}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news | title = Stuart Pearce takes positives from under-21 defeat | url = https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/worldcup/stuart-pearce-takes-positives-from-under21-defeat-2136476.html |newspaper=The Independent |location=London | date = 17 November 2010 | accessdate = 16 July 2014}}</ref> His final appearance for the under-21s came in an international friendly against [[Italy national under-21 football team|Italy]] in February 2011 at the [[Stadio Carlo Castellani]] in [[Empoli]].<ref name="Italy U21 1-0 England U21">{{Cite news | title = Italy U21 1–0 England U21 | url = http://www1.skysports.com/football/live/match/232068/teams | publisher = Sky Sports | date = 17 November 2010 | accessdate = 16 July 2014}}</ref> He came on as a second-half substitute for [[Josh McEachran]] in a 1–0 defeat.<ref name="Italy U21 1-0 England U21"/>
===Senior=== [[File:Kieran Trippier 2018-06-13 1.jpg|thumb|upright|Trippier during training with [[England national football team|England]] at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]]]]
Trippier was called up to the [[England national football team|senior team]] for the first time in May 2017 for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification|2018 World Cup qualifier]] against [[Scotland national football team|Scotland]] and the friendly match against [[France national football team|France]],<ref>{{cite news | title = National team call up | url = http://www.tribalfootball.com/articles/southgate-backs-tottenham-fullback-trippier-to-excel-for-england-4183995 | publisher = Tribal Football | date = 31 May 2017 | accessdate = 3 June 2017}}</ref> making his debut against the latter on 13 June in a 3–2 defeat.<ref>{{cite news |title=France beat England 3–2, but which players stood out at Stade de France? |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/06/13/france-beat-england-3-2-players-stood-stade-de-france/kieran-trippier-france-beat-england-3-2-paris-players-stood/ |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=13 June 2017|accessdate=18 June 2017}}</ref>
He was named in the 23-man [[England national football team|England national team]] squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44138600 |title=England World Cup squad: Trent Alexander-Arnold in 23-man squad |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 May 2018 |accessdate=17 May 2018}}</ref> On 11 July 2018, Trippier scored his first England goal, opening the scoring with a free-kick in a 2–1 extra-time loss to [[Croatia national football team|Croatia]] in Moscow. He was injured in extra time with all substitutions played, so England played the final ten minutes with ten men.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/live/football/43976787 |title=Heartbreak All over Again As England Lose World Cup Semi Final |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 July 2018 |accessdate=11 July 2018}}</ref> He was widely praised as one of the best performers for the England team at the World Cup,<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/world-cup/world-cup-2018-england-player-ratings-report-card-players-class-gareth-southgate-future-a8449576.html |title= World Cup 2018: England report card - who’s top of the class and the players with extra work to do over the summer|first=Jack |last=Pitt-Brooke |work=The Independent |date= 16 July 2018 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/club/england/448/blog/post/3567433/englands-top-performers-in-russia-include-kieran-trippier-harry-maguire-and-jordan-pickford |title=England's top performers in Russia include Kieran Trippier, Harry Maguire and Jordan Pickford|date=16 July 2018|first=Liam |last=Twomey|work=ESPN |accessdate=26 August 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2018/jul/08/kieran-trippier-ascent-spirit-england-winged-wonders-world-cup |title=Kieran Trippier’s ascent captures spirit of England’s winged wonders |first=Barney |last=Ronay |date= 8 July 2018 |work=The Guardian |accessdate=26 August 2018}}</ref> particularly for his crosses and dead-ball delivery on set pieces, prompting comparison with [[David Beckham]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/12098/11416604/world-cup-supplement-kieran-trippier-englands-best-crosser-since-david-beckham |title=World Cup Supplement: Kieran Trippier England's best crosser since David Beckham|date= 26 June 2018 |work=Sky Sports}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.ft.com/content/d00add92-8063-11e8-bc55-50daf11b720d |title=Trippier’s journey from fringe player to England World Cup star|first1=Murad |last1=Ahmed |first2= John|last2= Burn-Murdoch |date=11 July 2018|work=Financial Times |accessdate=26 August 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/12016/11431181/eric-dier-says-kieran-trippier-worthy-of-david-beckham-comparisons |title= Eric Dier says Kieran Trippier worthy of David Beckham comparisons|first= Husmukh |last=Kerai |date=9 July 2018|work=Sky Sports|accessdate=26 August 2018}}</ref> He was ranked the most creative player of the tournament, having created 24 chances in all games played.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.squawka.com/en/news/revealed-the-top-five-most-creative-players-at-the-2018-world-cup/1047854 |title=Revealed: The top five most creative players at the 2018 World Cup |first= Mohamed|last= Moallim|date= 16 July 2018|work=Squawka|accessdate=26 August 2018}}</ref>
==Personal life== Trippier has a brother, [[Kelvin Lomax]], who also played professional football but used his mother's surname in his professional career.<ref>{{Cite news| title = New dad Trippier| url = http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/first-team/general/kieran-trippier-family-values-wedding-manchester-city-and-united-101216/| website=tottenhamhotspur.com| date = 10 December 2016| accessdate=8 September 2018}}</ref> In June 2016, Trippier married Charlotte in Cyprus and a child, Jacob, was born in December 2016.<ref name="New dad Trippier">{{cite web |url=https://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news-archive-1/new-dad-trippier-family-values-wedding-changes-and-choosing-city-over-united/ |title=New dad Trippier |publisher=Tottenham Hotspur F.C. |date=10 December 2016 |accessdate=11 July 2018}}</ref>
